RelatedSentence: THE potential impact of growing support for Ukip in Wales is laid bare in a new poll which suggests the Conservatives could lose their European seat and the Liberal Democrats may be left with just one AM in the Assembly .

THE potential impact of growing support for Ukip in Wales is laid bare in a new poll which suggests the Conservatives could lose their European seat and the Liberal Democrats may be left with just one AM in the Assembly .

The latest edition of the Welsh Political Barometer - a collaboration between ITV Wales , the Wales Governance Centre at Cardiff University and YouGov - shows Labour is on course to win the biggest share of the vote ( 33 % ) in this week 's European elections but that its support has dropped by six percentage points since February .

The latest edition of the Welsh Political Barometer - a collaboration between ITV Wales , the Wales Governance Centre at Cardiff University and YouGov - shows Labour is on course to win the biggest share of the vote ( 33 % ) in this week 's European elections but that its support has dropped by six percentage points since February .
Among those most likely to vote , Labour leads on 32 % , followed by Ukip ( 22 % ) , Plaid Cymru ( 17 % ) , the Conservative ( 16 % ) and the Lib Dems ( 7 % ) .

For the next Westminster election , Labour leads on 43 % ( - 4 ) , followed by the Conservatives on 22 % ( no change ) , Plaid Cymru on 11 % ( no change ) , Ukip on 13 % ( +4 ) and the Lib Dems on 7 % ( no change ) .
This could leave give Labour 31 MPs ( +5 ) , the Conservatives five ( - 3 ) , the Lib Dems two ( - 1 ) and Plaid two ( - 1 ) .

For the constituency vote , Labour leads on Labour 39 % ( - 3 ) , followed by the Conservatives on 20 % ( - 1 ) , Plaid on 19 % ( no change ) , the Lib Dems on 8 % ( - 1 ) , Ukip on 10 % ( +5 ) .

When combined with regional list polling , this suggests Labour could have 29 Assembly seats ( - 1 ) , followed by the Conservatives on 12 ( - 2 ) , Plaid on 10 ( - 1 ) , Ukip on eight , and the Lib Dems on one ( - 4 ) .
